thread.title: Chinese woman hides knife in hair to board plane
thread.title_full: Chinese woman hides knife in hair to board plane

title: Chinese woman hides knife in hair to board plane
text:
Chinese woman hides knife in hair to board plane Last updated 10:17, October 12 2015 YOUTUBE/VEVO1 
The fruit knife masqueraded as a hair accessory, as the woman attempted to sneak it through airport security. 
A Chinese woman tried to conceal a fruit knife in her bun as she went through security at an airport in Yunnan province, China. 
The passenger told security at Kunming Changshui International Airport last week that the 9cm knife was a hair accessory, reported the South China Morning Post. 
A security worker told media that the passenger was a visitor from Guangxi and was travelling to Yunnan during the National Day holiday. YOUTUBE/VEVO1 
The woman was caught on camera trying to get past security. 
"She bought some fruits when travelling in Yunnan and worried that the waiting time to board would be long," said the security worker. 
"So she wanted to bring a fruit knife to cut up her food as a snack." 
Security did not agree that the potential weapon was just a hair piece and it was confiscated. 
Staff had previously had issues with large amounts of alcohol trying to be taken onboard. In August, a passenger was told her US$200 (NZ$309) bottle of cognac exceeded the 100ml limit and couldn't be taken on board. She wasn't fazed, and instead sculled the entire thing. 
In July, security seized a lighter shaped like a grenade that exploded in a staff member's hand causing injury. Another passenger used a lighter to set a couple of seats on fire.
